No Breakfast or Lunches will be served on Friday, April 10 nor on Monday, April 13 due to holidays on School Calendar. Sorry for inconvenience and we hope you have an enjoyable Easter Holiday weekend.

Check back here for updates. We will continue serving meals (breakfast and lunch) as scheduled. We have already identified our Food Service personnel and prepping and delivery team as Essential Services in anticipation of a Governor’s order such as today. The Governor’s Executive Order 20-16 did not change anything for how Schools will be functioning from her Executive Order 20-07 dated March 17th. We will re-engage students virtually on Monday morning, March 30th. To Repeat: Breakfast and Lunch will be prepared, distributed, (Curbside pick-up ) Just Like Last Week. Please stay safe, socially distant, and stay home unless you have an approved reason to be out and about.

p.span: Message for All USD 331 Parents & Guardians pertaining to Breakfast & Lunches during the next few weeks.
Remember: No Cost to kids 1 yr through 18 yrs of age or still in high school. Kids that attend St. Pat’s are welcome.

Tomorrow Morning ONLY, we will serve Breakfast with Curbside Service at Kingman Elementary & Middle School big parking lot and at Norwich School on the East Side of the school. It will be served from 7:45 a.m. until 8:30 a.m. on Monday, March 23, 2020
Beginning with Lunch on Monday, we will begin distributing 2 meals per child. One will be their Lunch and the second will be their Breakfast for the next morning.
Example: If you have 3 kids in your household, you would pick up 6 meals (paper bags with meals) 3 will be Today’s lunch and 3 will be Tomorrow morning’s breakfast.
Lunch will be distributed Curbside at KEMS & Norwich School from 11:30a.m to 12:30 pm. Monday - Friday
We are going to set up a system where parents can communicate their wishes for numbers of meals so we can control waste while not running out of meals.

Please be patient with us. Scheduling times may change or be adjusted. We are open to adding sites if needed. It is very important that YOU are at a satellite site Waiting for US. We will have a tight schedule so won’t be sitting around waiting to see if anyone is going to show up.
We are still processing through some of our requirements so we ask for your understanding as we strive to provide this service for our kids.

IF something happens and we run out of meals, you may have to drive to your closest school to pick up meals. Again, we will do our best to be at your service and be well supplied. As I have said, we didn’t have a great response to our survey so we are making educated guesses. As we get closer to knowing needs, we can get more variety in our menus.
VERY IMPORTANT:
We will have a School Vehicle - A White Van or Suburban that will have USD 331 markings deliver the meals to our Satellite Meal Pick up locations below:

div.div: Curbside Pickup at KEMS & Norwich School will be 11:30 a.m.-12:30pm daily

p.span: Out of Town:
Spivey bus stop by Fire Department
Rago and Highway 14 and 42 intersection SE parking area
Adams on K-42
Belmont Elevator
Murdock Methodist Church
In Kingman:
South side of Kingman bus stop 4th & Brown
Kingman Hospital Parking Lot
Kingman High School Parking Lot (by Flag Pole)
Norwich Area:
Milton Baptist Church
Suppesville K-42 and North Boardwalk Rd.

hr.p: The April 13, 2020 School Board Meeting will be conducted Virtually and streamed on District Office Youtube channel. Link will be available about 30 minutes prior to meeting. Because the meeting will be conducted virtually, we will not be able to have live public comment. If any patron has a comment they wish to share with the board, please email that to the superintendent, mclark@knusd331.com by noon on Monday, April 13, 2020 so it can be shared. Agenda for April 13, 2020 here.

span.a: - Recording of Special Meeting April 6, 2020 here -

span.strong: Will be a VIRTUAL Meeting on

span.b: USD 331 District Office with limited access. Meeting will be live-streamed and recording posted on this website afterwards.
